page.title: 03A Day on the Farm in Durris
page.content: Farming is important in Durris,with a lot of beef cattle raised and crops like oats and barley grown.Here is a description of a typical farm day. First thing in the morning Dad milks the cow and gives the milk to Granny. He feeds his bulls which,are inside all the time until they are sold, usually in October.He then walks round all the other cows and calves to see if they are alright.Grandad feeds the hens and ducks and in the duck's house there are rats.Just now it is time for hoeing turnips and fencing and for better weather for the hay.About five o'clock they do the same again.My Grandad collects the duck's eggs and the hen's eggs and he feeds both sets of birds.There might be extra work to do in the evening,so it can be a long and tiring day for the farmer.
